intro: Brunellia ternata, commonly known as the small-leaved waxtree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves with a waxy surface. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers followed by woody capsules containing numerous seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as montane forests. Its botanical features make it an important component of the understory in its native ecosystems.
